intro: Chamaesyce pilulifera, commonly known as the pillowy sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its root system is adapted to stabilize sandy soils and prevent erosion. Chamaesyce pilulifera is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
